DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Cytogenetics Positive t(15;17) Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of a positive lab test characterized by the t(15;17) translocation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Cytogenetics Positive t(15;17) Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the procedure of a positive lab test characterized by the t(15;17) translocation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Cytogenetics Positive Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia with t(15;17)(q22;q12); PML-RARA Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.:Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI):An acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.  It is characterized by the t(15;17)(q22;q12) translocation.  There are two variants: the typical and microgranular variant.  This AML is particularly sensitive to treatment with all trans-retinoic acid and has a favorable prognosis.  (WHO, 2001):Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The branch of biology that studies the cellular aspects of heredity, especially the chromosomes. Includes the study of disease states caused by numerical and structural chromosome abnormalities.
Confirmation of something, such as a positive lab test. In medicine, a positive lab test indicates the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism. (NCI)

Concepts.longName: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia with t(15;17)(q24.1;q21.2); PML-RARA
Concepts.definition: An acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate. It is characterized by the PML-RARA fusion. There are two variants: the typical and microgranular variant.  This AML is particularly sensitive to treatment with all trans-retinoic acid and has a favorable prognosis. (WHO)
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The result of a positive lab test.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A molecular entity formed by loose association involving two or more component molecular entities. The bonding between the components is normally weaker than in a covalent bond.

Concepts.definition: A molecular entity formed by loose association involving two or more component molecular entities. The bonding between the components is normally weaker than in a covalent bond.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Easy, not involved or complicated, not elaborate, having few parts.

Concepts.definition: Easy, not involved or complicated, not elaborate, having few parts.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
